intro: Entadopsis schlechteri, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, velvety leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often with a compact rosette structure. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including shades of purple, pink, and white, and are pollinated primarily by bees and other insects. Entadopsis schlechteri is popular as a houseplant due to its ease of care and ornamental value.
